original: BERGGREN, Bengt Eugen Laurentius, Civilingenjör, Stocfkholm, f Oskarshamn 26/12 93 av ch.elektr F M B o Josefina Nilsson, gm Karin Heumann. Oskhns lärov, CTI (eltekn) 17. Anst ASEA 17—20, stat el inspekt 20, statsinsp f el starkströmsanläggn sed. 34, f el trådbuss-, sparv- o järnv.anläggn sed. 38, spec.insp h Yrkesinsp sed. 34. Vkst led Ktén f utarb av statl el säkerh.föreskr 34—36, k.m :ts led i Sv mtrlkontrollanst :s nmd, sakk h Sv El komm i krafttekn o install.tekn fråg, led ett flert ktéer o utsk f standardis o kontroll av el mtrl. Resor: Belg, Frankr, Holl, Tyskl, Norge, Danm, Finl, Estl 21—25. Av trycket: Upps o kommentarer betr el säkerh.föreskr mm. Hobbies: Färgfotografering, filmning, långfärder på skridsko.
translated: BERGGREN, Bengt Eugen Laurentius, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Oskarshamn on December 26, 1893, son of electrical engineer F M B and Josefina Nilsson, married to Karin Heumann. Educated at Oskarshamn High School, CTI (electrotechnical program) graduate at age 17. Employed at ASEA from 1917 to 1920, state electrical inspector from 1920, state inspector for high power electrical installations since 1934, inspector for electrical tram, tramway, and railway installations since 1938, specialized inspector for occupational safety since 1934. Played a leading role in the development of state electrical safety regulations from 1934 to 1936, member of the Swedish Central Control Authority Board, expert on power and installation technology issues for the Swedish Electrical Committee, member of several committees and panels for standardization and control of electrical materials. Traveled to Belgium, France, Holland, Germany, Norway, Denmark, Finland, and Estonia between 1921 and 1925. Published writings and comments on electrical safety regulations. Hobbies include color photography, filming, and long-distance ice skating trips.
